TILE_DESC_CANYON: Canyons protect non-air units from ranged attacks.
TILE_DESC_VOLCANO: None may pass the treacherous volcano.
TILE_DESC_ROCKS: Rocks provide heavy defensive cover but will damage units that rest on them.
TILE_DESC_ISLAND: A cluster of small islands providing some defensive cover at the cost of mobility.
TILE_DESC_HILL: Hills provide additional range to ranged units.
TILE_DESC_FOREST: Forests slow wheeled and tracked units, but will provide cover from attacks.
TILE_DESC_ROAD: Roads allow for quick movement, but provide no defensive cover.
TILE_DESC_MOUNTAIN: Mountains provide exceptional cover but are very hard to cross.
TILE_DESC_GRASS: Plains slow movement slighty but provide minimal cover against enemy attacks.
TILE_DESC_SHORE: Shores are the link between the land and sea. Order a Leviathan to pick ground troops up.
TILE_DESC_BRIDGE: Bridges are useful for connecting lands, but they lack defensive cover.
TILE_DESC_SEA: The open sea form the theater for naval combat.
TILE_DESC_RIVER: A relatively narrow body of flowing water, and the bane of every invader in history.
TILE_DESC_SWIRL: Reefs slow movement and improve defense against attacks.
TILE_DESC_RICH_ORE: Extractors can extract 500 [Cash] from this tile.
TILE_DESC_USED_ORE: Extractors can extract 300 [Cash] from this tile.
TILE_DESC_DEPLETED_ORE: Nothing else can be extracted from this tile.
